noun.description: A system of sending messages by holding the arms or two flags or poles in certain positions according to an alphabetic code.
examples: if you learn semaphore or the Morse code, you'll have a fun way to send messages

verb.description: Send (a message) by semaphore or by signals resembling semaphore.
examples: Josh stands facing the rear and semaphoring the driver's intentions

origin: Early 19th century (denoting a signaling apparatus): from French sémaphore, formed irregularly from Greek sēma sign + -phoros.
